00025 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00027 class SoftEquivFunctor {
00028 public:
00029    SoftEquivFunctor() : eps(1.e-15)
00030    { /* * */ }
00031 
00033    SoftEquivFunctor(double _eps) : eps(_eps)
00034    { /* * */ }
00035    
00037    bool operator() (const double target, const double ref) const
00038    {
00039       using std::fabs;
00040 
00041       // check relative error, zero-safe
00042       if (fabs(target - ref) <= fabs(ref) * eps) {
00043          return true;
00044       }
00045 
00046       // if the reference number is zero, allow epsilon
00047       if (ref == 0) {
00048          return (fabs(target) <= eps);
00049       }
00050 
00051       // if reference is non-zero and it failed the first test
00052       return false;
00053    } 
00054 
00055 private:
00057    const double eps;
00058 };
00059 
00060 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00062 class IsNonZeroFunctor {
00063 public:
00064    IsNonZeroFunctor()
00065    { /* * */ }
00066    
00068    bool operator() (const double target) const
00069    {
00070       if (target == 0) {
00071          return false;
00072       }
00073 
00074       return true;
00075    } 
00076 };
00077 
00078 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00080 class IsNonNegativeFunctor {
00081 public:
00082    IsNonNegativeFunctor()
00083    { /* * */ }
00084    
00086    bool operator() (const double target) const
00087    {
00088       if (target < 0.0) {
00089          return false;
00090       }
00091 
00092       return true;
00093    } 
00094 };

00100 template <class T, class functorT>
00101 inline bool vectorComp(   const T& target,
00102                           const T& ref,
00103                           functorT& theOperation)
00104 {
00105    Require(target.size() == ref.size());
00106 
00107    typename T::const_iterator tIter   = target.begin();
00108    typename T::const_iterator refIter = ref.begin();
00109 
00110    while(refIter != ref.end()) {
00111       // check the values of the current iterate
00112       if (vectorComp(*tIter, *refIter, theOperation) == false) {
00113          return false;
00114       }
00115       tIter++;
00116       refIter++;
00117    }
00118    return true;   
00119 }
00120 
00122 template <class functorT>
00123 inline bool vectorComp( const double& target, const double& ref,
00124                         functorT& theOperation)
00125 {
00126    bool result = theOperation(target, ref);
00127 
00128    return result;
00129 }

00132 
00134 template <class T, class functorT>
00135 inline bool vectorComp( const T& target,
00136                         functorT& theOperation)
00137 {
00138    typename T::const_iterator tIter   = target.begin();
00139 
00140    while(tIter != target.end()) {
00141       // check the values of the current iterate
00142       if (vectorComp(*tIter, theOperation) == false) {
00143          return false;
00144       }
00145       tIter++;
00146    }
00147    return true;   
00148 }
00149 
00151 template <class functorT>
00152 inline bool vectorComp( const double& target,
00153                           functorT& theOperation)
00154 {
00155    bool result = theOperation(target);
00156 
00157    return result;
00158 }

00165 template <class T>
00166 inline bool softEquiv(const T& target,
00167                         const T& ref, double eps = 1.e-15)
00168 {
00169    vectorCompStuff::SoftEquivFunctor myFunctor(eps);
00170 
00171    return vectorCompStuff::vectorComp(target, ref, myFunctor);
00172 }
00173 
00175 template <class T>
00176 inline bool hasNoZeros(const T& target)
00177 {
00178    vectorCompStuff::IsNonZeroFunctor myFunctor;
00179 
00180    return vectorCompStuff::vectorComp(target, myFunctor);
00181 }
00182 
00184 template <class T>
00185 inline bool hasNoNegatives(const T& target)
00186 {
00187    vectorCompStuff::IsNonNegativeFunctor myFunctor;
00188 
00189    return vectorCompStuff::vectorComp(target, myFunctor);
00190 }
